title: Advanced Instructional Design Course for Integrating Computational Thinking and STEM

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of Basic Scientific Theories and Research Methodologies, Experience in Programming or Data Analysis
context.additional_context: A problem-solving-centered learning environment using digital tools, emphasizing activities that model real-life STEM problems through CT (Computational Thinking)

learning_goals: Learners can decompose and abstract complex STEM problems to design algorithmic approaches.
Learners can apply the four core elements of computational thinking (decomposition, abstraction, algorithm, automation) to STEM problems.
Learners can quantitatively evaluate CT-based decision-making in collaborative problem-solving processes.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
